episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of fascinating topics, including the unusual methods used in historical autopsies, the value and history of rare coins, the surprising ways allergies can be transferred through organ transplants, and the intriguing nature of parasitic plants like the Australian Christmas tree.

facts.fact: The coroner who did the autopsy of President McKinley injected part of him into a dog.
England's worst ever pennies are worth 350 pounds each.
In theory, you can get a peanut allergy transplant.
The largest parasite in the world is a Christmas tree.
